ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"1npuq","text":"The investigator will ensure that this study is conducted in full conformity with the principles set forth in The Belmont Report: Ethical Principles and Guidelines for the Protection of Human Study participants of Research, as drafted by the US National Commission for the Protection of Human Study participants of Biomedical and Behavioral Research (April 18, 1979) and codified in 45 CFR Part 46; 62 Federal Regulations 25691 (1997) and the Declaration of Helsinki and Good Clinical Practice (GCP).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: National Institute of Neurological Diseases and Stroke

manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"697r1","text":"Ali, M.K.; Gong, S.; Nojkov, B.; Burnett, C.; Chen, J.D.Z. Best Parameters of Heart Rate Variability for Assessing Autonomic Responses to Brief Rectal Distention in Patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome. Sensors 2023, 23, 8128. https://doi.org/10.3390/s23198128","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":205,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":219,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":213,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"eaioq","text":"The barostat is a FDA approved device (K99 1288)used in clinical practice and research to study the function and activity of the motor and sensory functions of the gastrointestinal tract. This is a common method used to measure gastric motility (or the movement of food from the mouth through the pharynx(throat), esophagus, stomach, small and large intestines and out of the body). It can monitor volume changes while maintaining a set constant pressure and deliver controlled distensions of gastrointestinal organs. The controlled distension is completed by the device’s ability to inflate at the tip of the catheter. In this study, the device was used in the rectum. This device does not use electricity to stimulate the rectum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67orr","text":"This device is not being studied. Rather it is used to collect measurements. In this case, we used the barostat device to monitor the activity in the rectum. The rectum of the GI tract is thought to have abnormal activity in study participants with IBS-C, contributing to their symptoms.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66f7d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8plur","text":"Three ECG electrodes connected to the ECG machine were placed on the study participant’s skin, one on the manubrium of the sternum, one above the breast bone, and one on the study participant’s right chest. These three electrodes were used for recording the ECG.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d94lj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crmra","text":"The author-developed MATLAB code was used to detect R peaks from the recorded ECG and an HRV signal  (RR intervals) was generated during baseline and rectal distension. This HRV signal was then used to calculate the HRV parameters. Sympathetic Index, Root Mean Square of Successive Differences (RMSSD), RSA, SD1, SD2, SD2/SD1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dsd6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7s4q8","text":"HRV software named \"HRV Analyzer\" was used to calculate the other HRV parameters. SDNN, SDNN Index, HF, HFn, LF, LFn, LF/HF etc. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"406dc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8gne","text":"Both the MATLAB Code and HRV analyzer software are shared in the repository.  https://doi.org/10.26275/nung-b9bm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":34}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"355AFEDACC2811EE973C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.26275%2Fnung-b9bm\u0026data=05%7C02%7Cmuhammal%40med.umich.edu%7Cbcd6142c59a54839f91e08dc2d2178a0%7C1f41d613d3a14ead918d2a25b10de330%7C0%7C0%7C638434869024749644%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C\u0026sdata=w4%2F%2FfEauIa9i0LLYHnSsrsNQWUquIJTpdbmWx%2BELhxM%3D\u0026reserved=0"}}}}

Neurosci. 2020, 13, 1447. https://doi.org/10.3389/fnins.2019.01447.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":86,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":99,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":107,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":115,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":121,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":130,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":134,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":144,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":152,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":159,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":168,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":177,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":180,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":196,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":206,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":210,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":221,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":227,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":232,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":245,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":269,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":278,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":263,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fik0q","text":"

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ego8m","text":"Twenty-two patients with IBS (constipation-dominant or IBS-C) were recruited initially. Nineteen patients had completed all five visits and recordings throughout the study. Out of the nineteen patients, two patients were excluded because of their HRV data were considered outliers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4somt","text":"Since each patient will serve as his/her own control, the actual proportion of IBS subtypes in recruited patients should not affect the study outcomes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fb38o","text":"Each participant came to the clinic five time throughout the study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duc3b","text":"All medications known to affect the gut will be discontinued 48 h before each session. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eum76","text":"The patients were fasted overnight and given arectal enema (250ml) to clean the rectum. After a 30-min rest, a polyvinyl catheter attached with a non-compliance polyethylene bag (500ml capacity and 10cm long) will be inserted and placed 5-15cm from the anal verge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdcva","text":"After the 15 min rest(“baseline”), the bag will be distended using an FDA-approved barostat device at 60 ml/min until the maximum tolerance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dfqo","text":"Rectal distention was performed at different pressures from 5 mmHg to the maximum tolerable pressure with an increment of 5 mmHg. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ld37","text":"Each distension lasted for 30s and was followed by a 30s rest period when the balloon was deflated.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k5tf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"251le","text":"During the distention period (“Rectal Distention”), the patient will be asked to circle the following sensations:1) first sensation,2) urge to defecate, 3) discomfort or pain and 4) maximal tolerance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f97a6","text":" electrocardiogram (ECG) was recorded at the rectal distention period for each individual to assess their autonomic function. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvidc","text":"An electrocardiogram (ECG) was recorded for 15 min at baseline to assess their autonomic function (through analyzing the HRV data, described below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mq0c","text":"Placement of the electrodes: place the RA electrode under the right clavical within the rib cage frame; place the LA","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37joo","text":"electrode under the left clavicle within the rib cage frame; place the LL electrode on the lower left","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76g9e","text":"abdomen within the rib cage frame).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cio8q","text":"The interbeat interval (RR interval) signal was calculated from the recorded and refined (after removing the segments of the ECG signal with noise, removing ectopic beats, and inserting interbeat wherever the peak was missed) ECG signal to calculate the HRV parameters; the Sympathetic Index (SI), Root Mean Square of Successive Differences (RMSSD), Respiratory Sinus Arrythmia (RSA) and SD1and SD2 of the Poincare Plot and their ratio (SD2/SD1) were calculated by using MATLAB code developed by the authors. The frequency-domain parameters of the SDSD, SDNN, and SDNN Index and HF, LF, HFn, LFn and LF/HF were calculated by using previously validated software developed in the lab. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81thb","text":"The robustness/reproducibility of each HRV parameter was evaluated by comparing their values among each visit as described below.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31qjl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gn8h","text":"A Shapiro–Wilk normality test was performed on each HRV parameter before each comparison. If the parameter was normally distributed, the paired t-test was applied to investigate the difference between the baseline and rectal distension. Otherwise, if not normally distributed, a Wilcoxon test was performed to investigate the differences. To test the reproducibility of the HRV parameters, the baseline and RD values of each visit were compared. The baseline values of all the five visits were compared by using a one-way ANOVA for the normally distributed data and a Kruskal–Wallis test for the data that were not normally distributed, followed by a Dunn’s multiple comparison test. The procedure was repeated by using HRV values during rectal distension and compared among 5 visits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Heart Rate Variability Parameters for Assessing Autonomic Responses to Brief Rectal Distention in Patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome
title_html: Heart Rate Variability Parameters for Assessing Autonomic Responses to Brief Rectal Distention in Patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome

versions.title: Heart Rate Variability Parameters for Assessing Autonomic Responses to Brief Rectal Distention in Patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome
versions.title_html: Heart Rate Variability Parameters for Assessing Autonomic Responses to Brief Rectal Distention in Patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cal6","text":"The immediate risks involved with barostat inflation and subsequent rectal distension include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5mgk","text":"Discomfort during the balloon insertion.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q2k8","text":"Sensation (discomfort) with the balloon inflation which is a variable of the study. The likelihood of this risk is common, up to 100% of participants will experience discomfort. The study team will make the study participant aware of this before consenting to the procedure. The study participant has the right to stop the procedure at any time.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j3v","text":"Bleeding at the site of balloon inflation (in the rectum).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbv6v","text":"The likelihood of this risk is rare, approximate incidence of \u003c1%. However, the duration of rectal distention is brief and the distention can be immediately terminated upon intolerable pain or discomfort.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pjc6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c7tf","text":"The long range risk of barostat inflation is:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o4vn","text":"Perforation of the rectum into the peritoneal space, the likelihood of this risk is rare, approximate incidence of \u003c1%.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"he3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nd08","text":"The risk involved with the ECG recording:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bulgc","text":"Allergic reaction of ECG electrodes.The likelihood of this risk is rare, approximate incidence of\u003c1%","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
